title: [Bug] __post_init__ uses falsy check for timestamps which treats '0' as empty
summary: Added regression test confirming that non-empty timestamp strings (including '0' and 'False') are correctly preserved by __post_init__. The current implementation is correct because non-empty strings are truthy in Python.
acceptance_criteria_met: Todo(id=1, text='test', created_at='0', updated_at='0') preserves '0' values
Todo(id=1, text='test', created_at='') generates new timestamp
Todo(id=1, text='test', created_at='2024-01-01T00:00:00+00:00') preserves the provided value
implementation_notes: The issue description was incorrect - in Python, non-empty strings like '0' and 'False' are truthy, so `if not self.created_at:` works correctly. Only empty strings are falsy and trigger timestamp generation.
